item.title: Overflowing bins and rubbish for weeks, 10th November
item.description:
Outside properties 149/151 Chipperfield Road, there are several overflowing bins and rubbish strewn all over the place. It has been like this for a while and it makes it difficult to walk past with dogs etc who will eat anything. It’s a health hazard
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 153, Chipperfield Road, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Hole in Road needs Tarmacking, 10th November
item.description:
There are two patches in the road that had metal plates on them. One, on the right, has been tarmacked over. But the other, on the left, has not been. This is causing issues for cyclists and other roads users as the metal plate is raising above the ground.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nairne Grove, Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding directly outside my house, 10th November
item.description:
Subject: Urgent – Flooding Outside My Home, Causing Safety & Accessibility Risk Dear Sir / Madam, I write to report a serious issue of persistent flooding on the road outside my house that is affecting my safety and wellbeing. Location: 20 Riverdale Rd., DA5 1QX Nature of the problem: After heavy rainfall water accumulates along the kerb and remains on the pavement and carriageway. This causes passing traffic to splash pedestrians and also means I cannot safely exit my vehicle parked outside my home without stepping into deep water. I am unable to unload shopping from my car, and parking/use of the pavement adjacent to my property is unsafe. I am over 70 years of age and currently undergoing treatment for a bad back; this flooding issue therefore poses a significant threat to my health, mobility and independence. Cause and proposed remedy: It appears the highway drainage (gulleys/kerb drains) in this location are blocked or not functioning properly, leading to water retention after rain. I believe that clearing the road drains and ensuring the gullies are maintained will remedy the problem and restore safe access for pedestrians and vehicles. Legal / Obligation grounds: As the local highway authority, the Council has a responsibility to maintain the highway in a condition safe for road and footway users. Given the flooding is causing an immediate risk to a vulnerable road and pavement user, I respectfully request the Council acts as soon as possible to inspect and clear the drainage at this location. I would appreciate a confirmation that this matter has been received and an indication of when inspection or remedial work will be arranged. Thank you in advance for your prompt attention to this matter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Riverdale Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road block creating hazardous intersection for commuting cyclists, 10th November
item.description:
A new fence set up by Westminster seems to be blocking the way for cyclists. This already hazardous intersection (cyclists re-joining the bike lane from constitution hill road car lane with no regard for priority traffic) is now been made extra hazardous as incoming and ongoing traffic are forced through a small gate. A second gate could resolve this slightly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Constitution Hill, Victoria, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Avondale Road, Plaistow, London
